qas.question: What was the first film Industrial Light & Magic did the visual effects for?

context: Also in 2005, Spielberg directed a modern adaptation of <b9_0>War of the Worlds<b9_0/> (a co-production of <a0_0>Paramount and DreamWorks<a0_0/>), based on the <a1_0>H. G. Wells<a1_0/> book of the same name (Spielberg had been a huge fan of the book and the original <a2_0><b5_0>1953<b5_0/><a2_0/> film). It starred Tom Cruise and Dakota Fanning, and, as with past Spielberg films, <a3_0>Industrial Light & Magic<a3_0/> (ILM) provided the visual effects. Unlike E.T. and <b6_0>Close Encounters of the Third Kind<b6_0/>, which depicted friendly alien visitors, War of the Worlds featured violent invaders. The film was another huge box office smash, grossing <a4_0>over <b7_0><b8_0>$591 million<b8_0/><b7_0/> worldwide<a4_0/>.
